issue.title: adguardteam.github.io
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapps.samsung.com%2Fappquery%2FappDetail.as%3FappId%3Dcom.sec.android.app.sbrowser%26cId%3D000005006635](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fadguardteam.github.io%2FAnonymousRedirect%2Fredirect.html%3Furl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fapps.samsung.com%252Fappquery%252FappDetail.as%253FappId%253Dcom.sec.android.app.sbrowser%2526cId%253D000005006635) ### Comment > I have a serious trouble using Adguard. First, ads didn’t be blocked at all. Only at a minority of app Adguard works, and for the common apps like Internet or Youtube Adguard doesn’t work at all. Second, some applications do not work while using Adguard. It makes me really uncomfortable. I need to stop operating Adguard and can use the other apps. > Actually, I already asked about my first problems before and you answered ‘adjust HTTPS filter.’ However, I already adjusted that filter. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/tlw6sjp4p3k8c880scgk4cg0g44kcw06djgvinogh0.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- Platform: | Android 10 AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Android v4.1.101;4.1.101 Browser: | Samsung Browser AdGuard mode: | VPN Filtering quality: | High-quality HTTPS filtering: | enabled Stealth mode options: | Send Do-Not-Track header,
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Self-destructing first-party cookies (4320),
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180) DNS filtering: | server: `System`
